dict.string: fn: Append clipboard content to note
fn: Append clipboard content to note
fn: Append clipboard content to note
fn: Append clipboard content to note
An Alfred Workflow with more than a dozen utility features for Obsidian
Warning: Invalid resolution 0 dpi. Using 70 instead.
Save as Base64 in Obsidian's Snippet Folder

if application "Obsidian" is not running then tell application "Obsidian" to activate delay 1.2 end if
tell application "Obsidian" to open location "obsidian://advanced-uri?commandid=quickadd%253ArunQuickAdd"
set parameter to do shell script "echo " & quoted form of (system attribute "parameter") & " | iconv -f UTF-8-MAC -t MACROMAN"

-- open quick switcher tell application "Obsidian" activate open location "obsidian://advanced-uri?commandid=switcher%253Aopen" end tell
-- set the clipboard to "{query}" delay 0.1 tell application "System Events" tell process "Obsidian" set frontmost to true click menu item "Paste" of menu "Edit" of menu bar 1 end tell delay 0.1 keystroke return using {command down} end tell
delay 0.1

if application "Obsidian" is running then set isRunning to "true" else set isRunning to "false" end if
tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to set configuration "ObRunning" to value isRunning in workflow (system attribute "alfred_workflow_bundleid")
return "{query}"

timestamp=`date '+%Y-%m-%d_%H-%M'` resolved_bkp_dest=~`echo -n $backup_location | sed -e "s/~//"` backup="$resolved_bkp_dest""/Obsidian-Backup_""$timestamp"".zip" vault=~`echo -n $vault_path | sed -e "s/~//"`
# directory change necessary to avoid zipping root folder # https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/245856/zip-a-file-without-including-the-parent-directory cd $vault zip -r --quiet $backup ./*
# restrict number of backups actual_number=$((max_number_of_bkps + 1)) cd $resolved_bkp_dest ls -t | tail -n +$actual_number | tr '\n' '\0' | xargs -0 rm
echo "$backup"
Editor & Preview next to each other
Open current Note in Dual mode
You are using the Obsidian default theme, which uses no custom CSS file.

vault_path=~`echo -n $vault_path | sed -e "s/^~//"`
echo -n `cat "$vault_path""/.obsidian/appearance.json" | grep "cssTheme" | head -n 1 | cut -d '"' -f 4`

Select this if Obsidian's Documentation has undergone major updates

if application "Obsidian" is running then set ObRunning to "true" else set ObRunning to "false" end if
tell application "Obsidian" open location "obsidian://advanced-uri?commandid=hotkey-helper%253Abrowse-plugins" activate end tell
delay 0.4 if (ObRunning is "false") then delay 1 tell application "System Events" to keystroke "{query}"
tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to set configuration "vault_path" to value "{query}" in workflow (system attribute "alfred_workflow_bundleid")

if application "Obsidian" is running then tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to set configuration "ObRunning" to value "true" in workflow (system attribute "alfred_workflow_bundleid") else tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to set configuration "ObRunning" to value "false" in workflow (system attribute "alfred_workflow_bundleid") end if
return "{query}"

-- delay depending on whether Obsidian was running or not set ObRunning to (system attribute "ObRunning") delay 0.1 if (ObRunning is "false") then delay 1 tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" to remove configuration "ObRunning" in workflow (system attribute "alfred_workflow_bundleid")
-- reveal properly in file explorer tell application "Obsidian" open location "obsidian://advanced-uri?&commandid=obsidian-collapse-all-plugin%253Acollapse-all-collapse" delay 0.2 open location "obsidian://advanced-uri?&commandid=file-explorer%253Areveal-active-file" end tell
-- scroll down, if appended to note set appendedNote to (system attribute "appendedNote") if (appendedNote is "true") then delay 0.2 tell application "System Events" to key code 125 using {command down} end if

# THESE VARIABLES MUST BE SET. SEE THE ONEUPDATER README FOR AN EXPLANATION OF EACH. readonly remote_info_plist='https://raw.githubusercontent.com/chrisgrieser/shimmering-obsidian/main/info.plist' readonly workflow_url='chrisgrieser/shimmering-obsidian' readonly download_type='github_release' readonly frequency_check='1'
# FROM HERE ON, CODE SHOULD BE LEFT UNTOUCHED! function abort { echo "${1}" >&2 exit 1 }
function url_exists { curl --silent --location --output /dev/null --fail --range 0-0 "${1}" }
function notification { local -r notificator="$(find . -type d -name 'Notificator.app')" if [[ -n "${notificator}" ]]; then "${notificator}/Contents/Resources/Scripts/notificator" --message "${1}" --title "${alfred_workflow_name}" --subtitle 'A new version is available' return fi
local -r terminal_notifier="$(find . -type f -name 'terminal-notifier')" if [[ -n "${terminal_notifier}" ]]; then "${terminal_notifier}" -title "${alfred_workflow_name}" -subtitle 'A new version is available' -message "${1}" return fi
osascript -e "display notification \"${1}\" with title \"${alfred_workflow_name}\" subtitle \"A new version is available\"" }
# Local sanity checks readonly local_info_plist='info.plist' readonly local_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${local_info_plist}")"
[[ -n "${local_version}" ]] || abort 'You need to set a workflow version in the configuration sheet.' [[ "${download_type}" =~ ^(direct|page|github_release)$ ]] || abort "'download_type' (${download_type}) needs to be one of 'direct', 'page', or 'github_release'." [[ "${frequency_check}" =~ ^[0-9]+$ ]] || abort "'frequency_check' (${frequency_check}) needs to be a number."
# Check for updates if [[ $(find "${local_info_plist}" -mtime +"${frequency_check}"d) ]]; then if ! url_exists "${remote_info_plist}"; then abort "'remote_info_plist' (${remote_info_plist}) appears to not be reachable."; fi # Remote sanity check
readonly tmp_file="$(mktemp)" curl --silent --location --output "${tmp_file}" "${remote_info_plist}" readonly remote_version="$(/usr/libexec/PlistBuddy -c 'print version' "${tmp_file}")"
if [[ "${local_version}" == "${remote_version}" ]]; then touch "${local_info_plist}" # Reset timer by touching local file exit 0 fi
if [[ "${download_type}" == 'page' ]]; then notification 'Opening download page…' open "${workflow_url}" exit 0 fi
download_url="$([[ "${download_type}" == 'github_release' ]] && curl --silent "https://api.github.com/repos/${workflow_url}/releases/latest" | grep 'browser_download_url' | head -1 | sed -E 's/.*browser_download_url": "(.*)"/\1/' || echo "${workflow_url}")"
if url_exists "${download_url}"; then notification 'Downloading and installing…' curl --silent --location --output "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" "${download_url}" open "${HOME}/Downloads/${alfred_workflow_name}.alfredworkflow" else abort "'workflow_url' (${download_url}) appears to not be reachable." fi fi

Visit the GitHub Page for Information on Configuration and Usage: https://github.com/chrisgrieser/shimmering-obsidian#readme
Created by @pspeudometa (Discord) aka @chrisgrieser (GitHub).
---
# Release Notes v. 1.7 New Feature: Search Recent Files - Search for *recently accessed files* with the new `or` search. Same modifiers (`cmd/ctrl/opt/fn/shift + return` and `shift` for preview) applies as with `o`
v. 1.6.2 - `search_ignore_attachments` now excludes attachment filetypes instead of attachment folders, in line with how the QuickSwitcher Core plugin works. - fixed bug where using root as attachment folder would break `o` search (thanks @porkchop). - fixed icons of themes and snippet folder
v. 1.6.1 - fixed bug where `odual`, `obackup`, templated-based note-creation and `snippet toggling` wouldn't work when *not* using `~` (issue #9).
v.1.6 **new feature** - when browsing folders with `o`, you have the option to go up to the parent folder. Now you can basically browse your vault fully via Alfred!
**Fixes & Internal** - reduced file size - some refactoring - bugfix for some edge cases with M1 filesystems - fixed empty aliases showing up in small vaults
v. 1.5.4 - OCR Screenshots have now a setting in the workflow configuration, where you can insert a prefix. - Default value is the date as before. - You can insert a different date format by following [Alfred's Placeholder-Syntax](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/advanced/placeholders/#date-time). - Leave the prefix empty or insert something else (e.g. a YAML-Header). Note that while not very visible, the workflow setting variables *do* accept multi-line values.
v. 1.5.3 - improved `odual`: now properly switches view mode, regardless of current view (issue #7)
v. 1.5.2 - fix `os` when there are no starred files
v. 1.5.1 - fix empty filenames when using on without parameter
v. 1.5 - Open notes in dual mode via `shift + return` when using the `o` or `os` search (issue #7). - Pass a parameter to `on`: - this parameter will become the title of the new note. - when using QuickAdd, this becomes the parameter for searching the QuickAdd options instead (issue #7).
v. 1.4 **New Feature** - access your starred searches via `os`
**Bugfixes** - fixed a bug where `on` does not work properly when used to activate quickadd while Obsidian is not running - fixed a bug where `odual` does not work properly when used while Obsidian is not running - added explanation to the documentation why `odual` cannot open a *linked* new pane (Obsidian does not expose that function to third-party apps)
v. 1.3.2 - changes the date formatting of OCR Screenshots to work better with more languages (issue #5).
v. 1.3.1 - fix for some theme screenshots not showing up properly
v. 1.3: Search Themes - `op` now also searches community themes (which unfortunately, can only be opened in GitHub) - use `op themes` to only search for themes. - use `shift` or `cmd + Y` to preview a theme. Use `shift` or `cmd + Y` to close the preview again.
- bugfix for tesseract installations via homebrew on M1 Macs (issue #3) - improved documentation to better explain which requirements are needed for what function (issue #4) - some refactoring
v. 1.2 - bugfix for `odual` command
v. 1.1: Public Release - Search starred files only via the keyword `os` - display starred status in general search (`o`) - display icon for installed plugins in Plugin-Search - small fixes
